title: Why cannot we live like Henry Thoreau? - Quora

response.answer_text: Though it is possible, we don't dare! There are two main reasons. The way we are brought up.Continuous shear from social knowledge.I am from an Indian family. From the day I was born, I was surrounded by a lot of people and their love or I may call it as care. Unknowingly we build up a strong bond with the people around us. It is like a SWEET WEB OF SPIDER, we turn very comfortable with it. 90% of the people never get a thought of leaving them. Remaining 10% , if at all they have thoughts of Thoreau they feel harder to come out of comfort and its sweetness (as we assume). In case anyone thinks of doing something crazy (we all call it so these days) like Thoreau, the next moment our mind starts thinking IF I DO SO? and our regular mind starts answering 1. I won't have a social life. 2. People think something wrong of me. 3. Only with basic requirements and materials, I can't survive. 4. I will not have any internet. And so on…… And finally , I think only one couple from UK is living so with their three children on an island called fafao in Tongan archipelago.
